comment: Very nice and caring teacher, unintentionally funny sometimes. A lot of vocabulary and a very generous grader if you put in a little study time! The workbook may be a little difficult.
She wants the best for her students, however, she does assign too much work in my opinion. It can pile up if you don't work on it as you're learning.
She genuinely wants the best for her students :)

Professor Lee is an amazing Korean professor. She responds to emails very quickly (Literally responded to my email at 1 AM). She really cares for each student. The lecture may seem boring at times but the class is really easy and she gives a lot of extra credit. 2 group projects. Yes, you need to put a little effort in but easy A.

Would recommend for others at least know the Korean alphabet before taking the class, it was fun and it helped me really memorize a lot of words. I'm taking her again, she made the class really enjoyable with simple directions. Attendance is required, she gives bonus points and there's only 1 group project that's very simple.

I love Professor Lee! She's absolutely amazing and she really wants you to learn. She's always available for questions and is super caring. I've learned so much and I'm taking her again next semester. Attendance matters but if you work hard and apply yourself to learning the material you will pass AND learn Korean well.

Great teacher! She's really really friendly and patient. I took this class during the pandemic so we had synchronous online classes. A heads up, participation matters. She'll call on you in (virtual) class usually in alphabetical order but sometimes randomly so be prepared. You also definitely have to put in the work, this class isn't an easy A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: LOVED HER. Workbook, exams, quizzes, and tests were most of the grade. The workbook was easy. Lessons 0,1,2 are exam 1 and Lessons 3 & 4 are exam 2. Tests are after each lesson. Vocab quizzes happened on the first two days of that lesson but could be retaken the day before the test to get a better grade. 100% recommend. She wanted us to learn it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Lee is super nice. She wants every one of her students to do well. Just do you assignments, show up to class, and study before tests and you'll do fine. The material is definitely harder then KOR 1001 & 1002, but that is expected. There are two big group project assignments which are more annoying than helpful, but besides that, its fine.
